items.title: Meet the 20 top-funded startups and tech companies in Hong Kong
Indian game publisher Felicity Games secures $3m seed funding
items.author: Anurag Choudhary
items.summary:
- India-based mobile game publisher Felicity Games has raised US$3 million in seed funding.
- Funding round was led by 3one4 Capital with participation from T-Accelerate Capital, MIXI Global Investments, and existing investors DeVC and Visceral Capital.
- The company specializes in hybrid-casual games and reported over US$1 million in annual recurring revenue with over 1 million downloads for titles like Seek & Find and Nova Solitaire.

items.title: Fleet tech firm Motive to double Indian workforce
items.summary:
- Motive, a fleet technology firm, plans to double its workforce in India.
- The expansion aims to enhance their service capabilities in the region.
- This move aligns with Motive's growth strategy in the Asia-Pacific market.

items.title: Nvidia-backed AI firm signs $12b AI cloud deal with OpenAI
items.summary:
- CoreWeave signed a five-year contract worth US$11.9 billion with OpenAI for cloud computing services.
- OpenAI will receive US$350 million in CoreWeave shares during the company's upcoming IPO, which CoreWeave will not directly benefit from.
- CoreWeave reported US$1.92 billion in projected revenue for 2024, an increase from US$228.9 million in 2023, but recorded a net loss of US$863.4 million.

items.title: Gmail now lets users add events to calendar with Gemini AI
Angkas fuels up for PH rivalry with Grab
Singapore’s top-funded tech companies in the last decade
Australian energy firm EcoJoule raises $15m for solar solutions
Bluesky gives users control over AI data use
Alibaba.com expects all sellers to use AI by 2025
items.summary:
- Alibaba.com aims for all sellers to adopt AI tools by 2025, stated by president Zhang Kuo.
- Over half of the 200,000 merchants on the platform are already using these AI tools weekly for various business operations.
- Alibaba plans to invest 380 billion yuan (approximately US$52.3 billion) over three years to improve its cloud computing and AI infrastructure.

items.title: Indian D2C jewelry brand Giva raises $11.7m
items.summary:
- Bengaluru-based direct-to-consumer jewelry brand Giva raised approximately US$11.7 million through equity and debt funding.
- Funds were obtained from Alteria Capital and Northern Arc, with US$5.95 million raised in equity and US$5.7 million in debt.
- Giva plans to use the funds for general corporate operations and expanding its retail presence, currently operating 199 stores across various Tier I and Tier II cities.

items.title: Australia’s crowdfunding leader Birchal names new CEO
items.author: Not given
items.summary:
- Kirstin Hunter appointed as the new CEO of Birchal, an Australian crowdfunding platform.
- She succeeds co-founder Matt Vitale, who stepped down earlier this year.
- Hunter was previously in a transitional role before being selected by an external recruiter.
- The appointment follows a recent US$2 million capital raise for expansion.
- Birchal has secured notable funding including US$3.4 million for Medigrowth and US$3 million for Naked Life.
- Hunter plans to improve services, attract high-net-worth investors, and collaborate with policymakers.

items.title: Israeli cloud startup Eon secures $200m, improves data resilience
items.author: Ofir Ehrlich, Ron Kimchi, Gonen Stein
items.summary:
- Eon raised over US$200 million in funding within a year, leading to a valuation of US$1.4 billion.
- The startup aims to improve cloud data resilience and has described cloud backup for large systems as an underserved area.
- Eon's funding efforts reflect strong demand for its solutions and position it to compete in the global cloud infrastructure market.

items.title: Xpeng stock surges 7.1% on flying car, robot production plans
items.summary:
- Xpeng Inc. shares rose 7.1% on Mar. 10 after plans to mass-produce flying cars and industrial robots by 2026 were announced.
- Stock reached its highest level since August 2022, with year-to-date shares nearly doubling and outperforming the Bloomberg Intelligence index of global EV stocks.
- The surge is attributed to strong sales of new EV models, competitive pricing, and advanced autonomous features, amidst increasing investor interest in tech due to Hong Kong’s AI rally.
- Experts caution that financial impacts from the flying car and robot projects may take time to materialize.

items.title: Khazanah backs greentech firm for EV charging expansion
items.author: Not given
items.summary:
- Khazanah Nasional Berhad invests in chargEV, Yinson GreenTech’s EV charging arm.
- Investment announced on Mar. 10 to support Malaysia's low-carbon transition.
- Aims to expand chargEV’s network to meet a target of 10,000 EV charging points by the Ministry of Investment, Trade, and Industry.
- Malaysia currently has 3,611 charging points as of early 2025.
- Investment aligns with the National Energy Transition Roadmap (NETR).
- Dato’ Amirul Feisal Wan Zahir highlights strengthening of Malaysia’s EV infrastructure.
- Yinson GreenTech CEO Lim Chern Yuan states funding will meet growing demand for charging solutions.

items.title: Indian digital entertainment startup bags $8.5m for Gen Z content
Digital therapy firm Hinge Health files for New York IPO
items.summary:
- Hinge Health, based in San Francisco, has filed for an IPO to trade on the NYSE under ticker "HNGE."
- Founded in 2014, it offers digital physical therapy services, including virtual exercise therapy and nerve stimulation devices.
- The company reported $390 million in revenue for 2024, a 33% increase from the previous year, and narrowed its net loss to $11.9 million from $108.1 million in 2023.
- Over 2,250 organizations, including Morgan Stanley and Target, offer Hinge Health services to their employees.
- The company has raised over $1 billion and was valued at $6.2 billion in 2021, with 532,000 active members and 20 million eligible for enrollment.

items.title: Avatar startup AvatarOS secures $7m to create lifelike personas
items.author: Isaac Bratzel
items.summary:
- AvatarOS raised US$7 million in seed funding led by M13’s Latif Peracha.
- Investments also came from the Andreessen Horowitz Games Fund, HF0, Valia Ventures, and Mento VC.
- The company, founded by Isaac Bratzel in 2022, focuses on enhancing realism and individuality in digital avatars.
- AvatarOS is currently in beta testing and plans to release an API for clients to use avatars in their platforms.

items.title: Saudi fashion startup Aya completes $1.6m funding round
items.author: Munira Al Kadi, Abdulrahman Al Ammar
items.summary:
- Aya, a Saudi Arabia-based e-commerce platform, has completed a $1.6 million seed funding round.
- The funding was led by Khwarizmi Ventures, with contributions from Raed Ventures, Joa Capital, FENA Holdings, Turki Alrajhi, and several angel investors.
- The funds will be used for product development, market expansion, and enhancing platform capabilities.
- Founded in 2024 by Munira Al Kadi and Abdulrahman Al Ammar, Aya focuses on forecasting fashion trends and connecting local manufacturers with consumer demand.
- Aya operates within the modest fashion sector and uses real-time customer insights to improve manufacturing and supply chain efficiency.

items.title: Tech giants lose $750b as Nasdaq sees worst day since 2022
items.summary:
- The Nasdaq Composite reached a six-month low on March 10, declining over 4% last week.
- Seven major tech companies lost more than $750 billion in market value during the drop.
- Tesla fell over 9% and has decreased nearly 44% since January.
- Apple, Alphabet, and Meta Platforms each experienced declines of over 5%.
- Nvidia lost nearly $140 billion in value with a 5% drop in shares.
- Amazon and Microsoft dropped about 3% amid increased scrutiny of the tech sector.

items.title: EU to fine Apple, Meta for digital market violations
items.summary:
- EU antitrust regulators are preparing to impose fines on Apple and Meta Platforms for alleged violations of the Digital Markets Act (DMA).
- Fines expected to be relatively low compared to the maximum penalties, which can reach up to 10% of global annual revenue.
- Both companies are under scrutiny for potentially breaching rules aimed at regulating major digital platform dominance.

items.title: San Francisco-based telematics insurer Nirvana bags $80m
items.summary:
- Nirvana raised US$80 million in Series C funding to enhance services for trucking fleets and individual drivers.
- The funding led by General Catalyst values Nirvana at US$830 million.
- The trucking industry, contributing over US$900 billion annually in the US, is facing challenges from new tariffs on imports from Canada and Mexico. 
- The new funding will help Nirvana expand technology and create tools for trucking businesses coping with increased operational costs.

items.title: Tesla shares drop 14%, biggest decline in 5 years
items.summary:
- Tesla shares fell 14% on Mar. 10, the largest single-day decline since September 2020.
- This drop follows a seven-week losing streak, the longest since Tesla’s Nasdaq debut in 2010.
- Tesla's stock has decreased by over 50% since reaching a peak of US$479.86 per share on Dec. 17, 2023, resulting in a loss of more than US$800 billion in market capitalization.

items.title: Apple plans major redesigns for iOS, iPadOS, macOS
items.summary:
- Apple plans a major redesign of iOS, iPadOS, and macOS, to be released later this year.
- Updates will feature changes to icons, menus, apps, windows, and system buttons.
- The redesign aims to simplify navigation and maintain consistency across Apple’s operating systems.
- Apple does not plan to merge its separate operating systems despite the updates.

items.title: Going solo may give Amazon Pay the edge it needs in India
items.summary:
- Amazon India is considering launching a standalone Amazon Pay app this year.
- This strategy mirrors GoTo's 2023 launch of the GoPay app in Indonesia.
- The initiative aims to increase Amazon Pay users and expand credit services in the future.
- Amazon has announced the acquisition of fintech startup Axio for US$200 million to bolster lending in India, pending regulatory approval.
- Amazon faces stiff competition from Google Pay and PhonePe, which dominate India's payment market with an 85% share.
- The company currently has 100 million UPI users and 50 million wallet customers in India.

items.title: Action, reflection, and insight from International Women’s Day
items.author: Stefanie
items.summary:
- The theme for 2025 International Women’s Day is "Accelerate Action."
- Tech in Asia's campaign focuses on supporting women in the tech ecosystem by featuring female leaders and updating their female founder tracker, which now lists a record 66 names.
- The campaign includes writing letters to younger selves by notable women in the ecosystem like Maria Li, Piruze Sabuncu, and Grace Sai to encourage reflection and sharing of experiences.
- Tech in Asia aims to promote both outward action (supporting women's rights) and inward reflection (personal growth).
- A personality quiz was created to promote self-reflection among participants, inspired by a viral trend on social media.

items.title: Bluesky introduces 3-minute videos, DM request approvals
items.summary:
- Bluesky has rolled out an update allowing users to upload videos up to three minutes long, an increase from the previous one-minute limit.
- This feature is part of the new version 1.99 currently being released.
- The update includes a “Chat Requests” feature that lets users approve or reject direct messages from unknown individuals, providing context on the sender's connection to the recipient's network.

items.title: Saudi digital bank Derayah soars 30% after $400m IPO
items.summary:
- Derayah Financial Co. shares rose 30% on their first day to 39 riyals (US$10.40).
- The IPO raised 1.5 billion riyals (US$400 million) by selling 20% of the company, valued at 7.49 billion riyals (US$2 billion).
- The offering was oversubscribed 162 times by institutional investors, priced at the top range of 30 riyals (US$8) per share.
- HSBC Holdings Plc was the sole bookrunner; Olayan Saudi Investment Co. invested about 2% in Derayah.
- Founded in 2009, Derayah manages assets worth 15.1 billion riyals (US$4.03 billion) as of June 2024, with a net income of 330 million riyals (US$87.97 million) in 2023 and a 53% profit margin.

items.title: Saudi proptech startup Ajras raises $1.5m
items.author: Muath Aljubailan
items.summary:
- Ajras raised $1.5 million in a pre-Series A funding round led by Veda Holding on Mar. 11, 2025.
- Founded in 2022, Ajras specializes in financing solutions for rent payments in the commercial and industrial property sectors.
- The startup launched a 'Rent Now, Pay Later' program and was licensed by the General Authority for Real Estate in Riyadh.
- In Nov. 2023, Ajras completed a seed funding round, raising approximately $28 million from Madarek International.

items.title: 10 tech and startup companies hiring actively in Asia this week
items.author: Tech in Asia Jobs team
items.summary:
- Weekly roundup of 10 popular companies hiring in Asia.
- Highlights various regions and job functions available.
- Encouragement to click for more details about job roles.

items.title: US stocks sink $4t as tariff policies fuel market turmoil
items.summary:
- The US stock market has lost over $4 trillion since February 19 due to economic uncertainty related to tariff policies.
- On March 10, the S&P 500 dropped 8.6% from its record high; the Nasdaq Composite confirmed a 10% correction since December.
- Major tech stocks like Tesla, Apple, and Nvidia experienced substantial losses, with Tesla’s market value dropping $125 billion in one day.
- The declines are linked to the Trump administration's tariffs on key partners such as Canada, Mexico, and China, creating business uncertainty.
- Defensive assets saw gains; US government debt demand increased, and hedge funds cut stock exposure at the highest rates in over two years.
- Market volatility is high, with the Cboe Volatility Index at its highest closing since August.
- Analysts warn ongoing trade tensions and mixed economic signals could prolong market instability.

items.title: Solar irrigation startup Agros nets $4.25m series A
items.summary:
- Agros secured $4.25 million in series A funding.
- Funding co-led by [Gaia Impact](https://gaiaimpact.com), [Schneider Electric Energy Access Asia](https://www.se.com/), and [Wavemaker Impact](https://wavemaker.vc/), with contributions from Global Innovation Fund and existing investors.
- Funds will be used for expansion in [Indonesia](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Indonesia), [Cambodia](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Cambodia), and [Myanmar](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Myanmar), product innovation, and digital infrastructure development.
- Agros has served over 6,000 smallholder farmers since 2019 and aims to partner with 30,000 farmers by 2027, targeting a collective income increase of $40 million and reducing 1 million tonnes of CO₂ emissions.

items.title: SoftBank-backed self-driving firm Wayve nears market launch
items.summary:
- Wayve Technologies, based in London, is close to a commercial launch with major automakers in the US and Germany.
- The company plans to introduce its driver-assistance system soon without revealing specific timelines or partners.
- Wayve's AI software adapts quickly to road conditions, performing well in US trials with 500 hours of data.
- The technology navigates using driving data rather than detailed maps, tested in vehicles like the Ford Mustang Mach-E and Jaguar I-Pace.
- Backed by SoftBank, Nvidia, Microsoft, and Uber, Wayve has been testing its system beyond the UK, first trialing in San Francisco last October.
- Unlike competitors, Wayve focuses on licensing its software to automakers rather than selling directly to consumers.
- The company is also collaborating with Uber for future autonomous vehicle deployment, with the required hardware already in millions of vehicles.

items.title: US fintech Rocket acquires real estate firm in $1.8b deal
Enterprise software firm ServiceNow to buy AI startup for $2.9b
items.summary:
- On Mar. 10, ServiceNow announced the acquisition of Moveworks for $2.85 billion in cash and stock.
- This is ServiceNow's largest acquisition and highlights its focus on AI-driven solutions.
- Moveworks specializes in AI-powered employee assistants and has raised over $300 million in funding.
- The company was valued at $2.1 billion in 2021 and serves over 350 enterprise clients, supporting more than 5 million employees.
- As of late 2024, ServiceNow reported nearly 1,000 AI customers with an annual contract value of $200 million for its “Pro Plus AI” offering.
- The acquisition reflects ServiceNow’s commitment to AI amidst increasing competition in the market.

items.title: Israeli AI company D-ID lays off 25% of workforce
items.summary:
- Israeli AI startup D-ID has laid off 22 employees, which is 25% of its workforce.
- Layoffs primarily affect staff in Israel as part of an efficiency initiative.
- Decision follows a recent partnership with Microsoft, though no direct link between layoffs and the partnership has been confirmed.
- This occurs amid ongoing workforce reductions in the Israeli tech sector, which has faced significant challenges this year.

items.title: Singapore Exchange to launch bitcoin futures for institutions
items.summary:
- Singapore Exchange Ltd. (SGX) will introduce bitcoin perpetual futures in the latter half of 2025.
- The offering is designed for institutional clients and professional investors only, excluding retail customers.
- These futures await regulatory approval from the Monetary Authority of Singapore to enhance access to cryptocurrency derivatives on a regulated platform.

items.title: Deliveroo to exit Hong Kong market after 9 years
items.summary:
- Deliveroo will cease operations in Hong Kong effective Apr. 7.
- The exit comes after nine years in the market, due to market-specific challenges and a strategic review.
- Deliveroo will sell selected assets to foodpanda, integrating customers, riders, and partners into foodpanda’s platform.

items.title: Indian youth hostel goStops raises $4.2m series A
Peak XV’s global surge: from SEA cuts to US push
items.summary:
- Peak XV Partners, spun off from Sequoia Capital in June 2023, is shifting focus from Southeast Asia to global markets, especially the US.
- The firm prioritizes backing startups targeting global markets and has conducted a US immersion tour for founders to meet industry leaders.
- AI is a key investment theme for Peak XV in the US, with notable investments in companies like Abita Healthcare and RapidCanvas.
- The VC has faced departures among senior leaders in Southeast Asia, raising questions about its regional plans.
- Peak XV is also looking to establish a US office and supports a new US-focused investment firm by Anandamoy Roychowdhary.

items.title: Asia Economic Summit 2025: navigating innovation, policy in ASEAN
items.summary:
- ASEAN's digital economy reached US$263 billion in 2024 with a 15% YoY growth.
- Indonesia's direct investment hit US$105 billion in 2024, a 20.8% increase.
- AES 2025 will be held on June 26, 2025, in Jakarta, focusing on economic growth and innovation strategies.

items.title: Taiwan stocks drop as TSMC falls below $30.4
items.summary:
- TSMC shares declined by 0.70% to NT$998.00 (US$30.33).  
- This is the first closure below NT$1,000 (US$30.40) since November 2024.  
- The decline in the Taiex index was by 116.92 points (0.52%) to 22,459.15, with turnover at NT$337.99 billion (US$10.27 billion).  
- Concerns over TSMC’s US$100 billion investment in Arizona and US recession fears contributed to the drop.  
- Analysts cite GDPNow tracker indicating potential negative US economic growth in Q1 2025.  
- Relevant links include TSMC's plans to hire 8,000 in 2025 and previous announcements regarding chip production timelines.

items.title: Indonesia mandates Eid holiday bonuses for Gojek, Grab drivers
items.summary:
- President Prabowo Subianto announced holiday bonuses for online motorcycle taxi and delivery drivers on Mar. 10.
- Notable attendees included Patrick Walujo (CEO of GoTo Gojek Tokopedia) and Anthony Tan (founder of Grab).
- Bonuses should reflect drivers' activity levels and will be determined by the Ministry of Manpower.
- An official circular regarding the bonuses will be issued soon, with considerations for service type and work hours.

items.title: Chocolate Finance faces backlash over reward program changes
items.summary:
- Chocolate Finance criticized for changes to the HeyMax Miles debit card rewards program.
- Two-mile-per-dollar rewards for all categories became unsustainable due to increased bill payments.
- AXS bill payments disabled; frustrations arose from poor communication and sudden restrictions.
- FAQ led to confusion, mistakenly suggesting AXS initiated the changes.
- Customer funds are safe, but liquidity withdrawals may be paused if buffers are depleted.
- Company emphasized clearer communication and no plans to restore AXS compatibility.

items.title: SEA’s AI firms take the battle elsewhere
items.summary:
- Southeast Asian AI startups are shifting focus away from developing large language models (LLMs) due to competition from giants like OpenAI.
- The emerging strategy is to build on existing technologies to provide services targeted at end users rather than creating foundational models.
- DeepSeek's introduction helps mitigate concerns over pricing control by foundational model providers, allowing regional startups to innovate without fear of excessive costs.

items.title: Indian e-scooter maker Ather converts shares ahead of IPO
items.summary:
- Ather Energy converted 173,000 compulsory convertible preference shares into 240 million equity shares on Mar. 8.
- The new shares have a face value of 1 rupee (US$0.0115) and will rank equally with existing shares.
- Current shareholders include Hero MotoCorp Limited and others.
- Ather expects to launch its IPO by April 2025, aiming for a valuation of around US$2.5 billion.

items.title: New and returning investors betting on SEA
items.summary:
- Some investors are returning to Southeast Asia's funding landscape after a six-month hiatus.
- Their renewed investments suggest confidence in the market or new ventures into the region.
- Identifying these investors can help startups target potential funding opportunities.

items.title: Saudi Arabia’s $8.8t Neom city faces delays, shortages
items.summary:
- Saudi Arabia's Neom project, a 105-mile-long city, faces substantial financial and logistical challenges.
- The project may take an additional 55 years to complete and could cost up to $8.8 trillion.
- Since its launch, the Neom initiative has utilized $50 billion of Saudi investment, exceeding 25 times the country's annual budget.
- Issues include labor shortages, infrastructure deficits, and energy supply problems.

items.title: Paytm issues equity shares worth $665k
items.summary:
- Paytm has issued equity shares valued at $665,000.
- The move is part of the company's financial strategy for raising capital.
- Details on the implications of this issuance have yet to emerge.

items.title: Foxconn unveils first AI model for manufacturing, supply chain
items.summary:
- Foxconn introduced 'FoxBrain', its first large language model for manufacturing and supply chain management.
- Trained on 120 Nvidia H100 GPUs for four weeks, based on Meta's Llama 3.1 architecture.
- Optimized for traditional Chinese and Taiwanese, capable of data analysis, decision support, document collaboration, problem-solving, and code generation.
- Initially for internal use; plans to collaborate with partners and share open-source elements.
- Training utilized Nvidia’s Taipei-1 supercomputer in Kaohsiung.
- More information to be revealed at Nvidia’s GTC developer conference later this month.
